Personal details.Born: Joseph John Thomson | ( | 1856-12-18 | ) | 18 December 1856 | Cheetham Hill, Manchester, England
Personal details.Children: George Paget Thomson, Joan Paget Thomson
Personal details.Alma mater: Owens College (now the University of Manchester) | Trinity College, Cambridge (BA)
Personal details.Known for: Plum pudding model | Discovery of electron | Discovery of isotopes | Mass spectrometer invention | Electromagnetic mass | First m/e measurement | Proposed first waveguide | Gibbs-Thomson equation | Thomson scattering | Thomson problem | Coining term 'delta ray' | Coining term 'epsilon radiation' | Thomson (unit)
Personal details.Awards: Smith's Prize (1880) | Royal Medal (1894) | Hughes Medal (1902) | Nobel Prize in Physics (1906) | Elliott Cresson Medal (1910) | Copley Medal (1914) | Albert Medal (1915) | Franklin Medal (1922) | Faraday Medal (1925) | Dalton Medal (1931)
